channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Melbourne's tough stage four lockdown would be extended by a fortnight before restrictions are eased more significantly on September 28, according to a draft blueprint.
item.title: Stage four lockdown to be extended by a fortnight under draft plan

item.description: Not even a pandemic was going to stop Mercedes-Benz from unveiling its flagship luxury car.
item.title: Mercedes takes a big risk with luxury car launch during a pandemic

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The ASX 200 is tipped to extend gains after another bumper session on Wall Street. The S&P 500 closed higher for the ninth time in 10 sessions.
item.title: ASX set to jump as Wall Street rally rolls on

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Victoria recorded 90 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, as Australia's pandemic recession was confirmed.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorian cases continue to decline as Australia officially enters recession, Australian death toll stands at 663

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The latest case of prison unrest occurred at Borallon Correctional Centre on Wednesday night.
item.title: Four cells damaged, two guards injured as prison chaos continues

item.description: Sydneysider Thompson is the first of four remaining Australians through to the third round in New York.
item.title: Jordan Thompson is set to collect his biggest US Open cheque - and he's not done yet

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: A spat is brewing over claims Chinese political dissidents, including prominent Melbourne-based artist Badiucao, have been been snubbed by the University of Western Australia's Confucius Institute.
item.title: Spat brews over alleged snub to Chinese dissident artist by UWA's Confucius Institute

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The same government that made provisions for a billionaire to exit and re-enter WA with minimal hassle wasn't prepared to do the same for the biggest event on Australia's sporting calendar.
item.title: WA wasn't snubbed, we just didn't want the grand final bad enough

item.description: Critics say the tanker is just one example of the socialist government’s corruption and mismanagement that has bankrupted the nation's petroleum industry.
item.title: Damaged Venezuelan oil tanker FSO Nabarima draws international concern

item.description: China is showing its export machine cannot be stopped — not by the coronavirus and not by the Trump administration.
item.title: China Inc roars back to life despite Trump and the pandemic

item.description: The warm-up event for the Australian Open will return in 2022.
item.title: Kooyong Classic cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: But a cold front will see the hot winds subside by Friday, with a cool weekend forecast.
item.title: Temperature to climb to 30 degrees across Sydney ahead of weekend cold front

item.description: The letter "K" has become more popular of late in discussions about the uncertain outlook for the economy. The pandemic and lockdown have only made a bad situation worse.
item.title: Not a special K: The US economic divide is widening

item.description: Julian Alaphilippe lost the overall lead after a 20-second penalty in a controversial fifth stage.
item.title: Penalty costs Alaphilippe yellow as Van Aert wins easy stage

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Joe Biden's 7.2 percentage point lead in the national RealClearPolitics average is almost exactly the same it was a month ago.
item.title: Post-convention polls show no significant gain for Trump among voters

item.description: The Japanese Coast Guard is searching for the Gulf Livestock 1, which issued a distress signal around 1.20am local time on Wednesday.
item.title: Ship with Australian crew members goes missing near Japan: reports

item.description: The S&P 500 closed higher for the ninth time in the past 10 sessions, with defensive and value stocks taking their turns to lead the gains.
item.title: Wall Street juggernaut rolls on, setting up the ASX for gains

item.description: The bulletin also said that Iranian and Chinese media had published materials questioning the mental health of Republican President Donald Trump, who is 74.
item.title: Report citing Kremlin effort to portray Biden as mentally unstable withheld by US agency

item.description: Melania's ex-BFF and aide, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, reveals the rumoured tensions between the first lady and Ivanka Trump in a new book.
item.title: Melania Trump's former friend details Ivanka feud in tell-all memoir

item.description: Neymar is one of three Paris Saint-Germain players who have tested positive for the novel coronavirus after taking a holiday in Ibiza, Spain, according to reports.
item.title: Neymar reportedly tests positive for coronavirus after holiday in Spain

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Tests by a German military laboratory have found the chemical nerve agent Novichok was used to "silence" the Russian opposition leader.
item.title: 'Unequivocal proof': Merkel hits out at attempted murder of Navalny using Soviet-era nerve agent

item.description: The US President joked to the former White House press secretary Sarah Sanders about her "taking one for the team" after Kim Jong-un winked at her during a summit in 2018.
item.title: Sanders says Trump joked about her 'taking one for the team' with Kim Jong-un

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: It has been decades in the making, but now one of Western Australia’s most famous chapters in its mining history finally looks set to be tested, with billions of dollars in iron ore rights at stake.
item.title: Clash of the dynasties: Legal showdown looms over Lang Hancock's multi-billion iron ore tenement

item.description: Britain's Prince Harry and his American wife Meghan have signed a multi-year contract with Netflix to produce different types of programs, the company said.
item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan sign deal with Netflix to produce programs

item.description: New studies confirm that multiple types of steroids improve survival for severely ill COVID-19 patients, cementing the cheap drugs as a standard of care.
item.title: Cheap steroids can help the sickest coronavirus patients, studies reveal

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The swing between El Ninos and La Ninas in the Pacific, operates with a kind of memory, with periods of low activity followed by stints of more extreme events.
item.title: El Nino lulls lead to harsh floods, fires and droughts: study

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The Queensland Labor Party has told supporters there will be no change to the border rules until after the state's October 31 poll.
item.title: '60 days to keep Queensland borders safe': the political row over borders

item.description: The German government says tests performed on samples taken from Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny showed the presence of the Soviet-era nerve agent Novichok.
item.title: Germany says it has evidence Putin critic Navalny was poisoned with Novichok

item.description: All the smart people I know are terrified Donald Trump can do it again, that he will energise his base and get the electoral college votes he needs to win the election.
item.title: Trump still able to pull re-election strings

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Wests Tigers are meant to play their last home game of the season at Bankwest Stadium. Plans are in place to change that and give Benji Marshall a Leichhardt Oval swansong.
item.title: Tigers to sacrifice $100,000 to give Benji Marshall a Leichhardt farewell

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Jacinda Ardern has been praised around the world for her leadership. Meet the woman who thinks the New Zealand PM can be defeated at the October 17 election.
item.title: Meet Judith Collins, the woman determined to defeat Jacinda Ardern

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Parents of stillborn babies or whose children die soon after birth will be allowed to take up to a year off work to grieve the loss of their child under new laws.
item.title: More leave on offer for grieving parents after stillbirths

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, September 3

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: Melbourne defender Neville Jetta is among 100 prominent Australians who have called for social media platforms to be held legally accountable over racial vilification.
item.title: Demand to tackle online racism after attacks on footy stars

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: A Senate inquiry says it should be up to federal parliament to set policy for new financial products that do not fit easily into the existing policy frameworks such as buy now, buy later schemes.
item.title: Fintech inquiry warns against 'one size fits all' regulation

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: New sources of renewable energy projects are forcecast to match last year's record levels despite a pandemic-induced economic downturn.
item.title: Renewables pour into grid at record rates despite COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: Thinking about how we could all age better rarely preoccupies our governments' treasuries. It should.
item.title: Ageing is not the problem. How we deal with it is

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Education degrees should follow medical ones in requiring more on-the-job training before teachers are fully qualified, an inquiry has heard.
item.title: Teaching degrees 'no longer meet the needs of complex classrooms'

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, September 3

item.dc:creator: Brian Toohey
item.description: China is the biggest source of refereed scientific journal articles in the world. The Morrison government needs to tread carefully in meddling with Australians' academic freedom to conduct research partnerships with China.
item.title: What you'd expect in dictatorships: why our universities fear Morrison's crackdown on China links

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Cochlear boss Dig Howitt says companies that generate income from their intellectual property should be rewarded to stop valuable talent from being lost overseas.
item.title: Biotechs push for IP tax incentives post-pandemic

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: The frequency of robberies committed in merchants’ stores in Sydney is getting out of hand.
item.title: In the Herald: September 3, 1835

item.dc:creator: Richard Bolt
item.description: Without gas, the transition to renewables will be slower and we will need to burn more coal to keep the lights on.
item.title: The Chief Scientist’s critics are wrong about natural gas

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The plans to relocate the station come just over a year after the station formed Fire and Rescue NSW's first all-Indigenous firefighting crew.
item.title: 'Demolition by neglect': Plan to move Redfern fire station angers locals

item.description: On September 3, 1975, sixteen died when the freighter Capitaine Bougainville caught fire and was abandoned in a gale off the north-east coast of New Zealand.
item.title: From the Archives, 1975: Survivors drift for hours in freezing seas

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Two criminals manipulated by Ms Gobbo and police gave evidence in more than 60 cases leading to nearly 30 convictions in some of the state's most significant trials.
item.title: Gobbo turned two 'supergrasses' whose work now puts dozens of cases at risk

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: An Australian invention is now being used to protect and restore priceless paintings in leading galleries around the world.
item.title: The invisible Australian goo on some of the world's most famous art

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 3, 2020

item.dc:creator: Jon Faine
item.description: Are we seeing real change or just window dressing?
item.title: Victoria Police must now have its ranks purged for a fresh start

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The Royal Sydney Yacht Squadron kept its finances shipshape despite the pandemic, thanks to some help from the great unwashed – otherwise known as taxpayers.
item.title: Government stimulus keeps Royal Sydney Yacht Squadron afloat
